TopicTitle: FanWork Fridays: Big Things Start Small

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_nb2sdxOVxH1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/391856cea31d83b4e7ae3a3b5b6d22c8/tumblr_inline_nb2shdVwkz1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>Kerbals have piloted some of the largest, most insane contraptions the universe has ever known, but <span class="author may-blank id-t2_82lkn userTagged">mchayoo</span><span class="RESUserTag"></span> lays out an important reminder that even Kerbals had to begin their journey somewhere. Big things start small.</p>

Aluminum Kerbals.....

Inspired by HarvesteR and Moach's screwing around with fireworks?

Aluminum Kerbals.....

Inspired by HarvesteR and Moach's screwing around with fireworks?

Ah! I've seen that before! Redirecting it now :3.
I recall the progression from KSP on up to Real Solar System. It's the truth, big things start small. ;P

You make it sound as if model rockets are small!*

Shameless Promotion, GO!

*Yes, I know that even some of the larger model-rocket designs are dwarfed by the parts in KSP. But you can't watch a launch like this and think that the rocket was small.

You make it sound as if model rockets are small!*

Shameless Promotion, GO!

http://youtu.be/VDgNC8yRmAE

*Yes, I know that even some of the larger model-rocket designs are dwarfed by the parts in KSP. But you can't watch a launch like this and think that the rocket was small.

WOOOOOO! That's all I can say!

When I was a kid many decades ago, I spent a LOT of my allowance on Estes and Centauri rocket parts. Even designed some of my own. Had the Estes Camera nosecone.

Good times...good times...

@UpsilonAerospace: great video. As a kid rocketeer, we couldn't even imagine having a video camera on a model rocket. Shameless promotion?!?! Nope. Just sharing an experience. Share more... Just slipped ya a forum Rep point as well.

// KSP now feeds that need.
